DOC.brief_summary: Evaluation of the effect of ingestion of high RS-cookies prepared from high amylose corn starch on food intake and appetite control of a cohort of healthy students. Cookies were prepared with increasing RS content and were fed to 18 healthy students in a blind trial versus a placebo. Parameters of interest were: short and long time intake (ad libitum test meal and 12 h diet diaries, respectively).
DOC.brief_title: High Resistant Starch (RS) Cookies and Appetite Control
DOC.criteria: selfreported healthy not suffering disorders of lipid metabolism and eating disorders pregnant or breastfeeding consuming an energyrestricted diet vegan or vegetarians
